Replies.Reply: The chickens' heads jerk up toward the sound.
ON RAY and WINSTON  Still backing up.
A HIDEOUS SPIRIT rises from its writhing body -- shapeless, but with monstrous glowing eyes and fangs.  The spirit lets out a ROAR more frightening than the Werechicken howl.
ECTO-2 is buffeted about by the howl as Peter jams the stick forward.
A fenced-in dirt area with numerous CHICKENS milling around, CLUCKING as they peck at the ground.
Sump'n's stirrin' up the chickens, Maude.
He scrambles backwards off the couch.
Had big blood-red eyes, it did.  Biggest dang chicken I ever seen.  Mebbe six feet tall.
What's got you girls so durned upset?
No more werechicken problems for us, eh, Egon?
Then she suddenly sits up and leaps off the haystack, revealing an enormous egg beneath her.  Maude SQUAWKS and CLUCKS and struts off into a cornfield, pecking away at ears of corn.
Egon, could you hold off on the weather balloon bit for a minute?
It's Your night to take out the trash.
Thanks, Slimer.  I really needed that!
Hey, even a half-baked false alarm sounds better than doing Egon's chores.
Why?  Lately even when he's with us, he's not with us.
Good.  Then he can hire a maid to do his share of the chores.
Thank you, Sir.  We'll put out a missing chicken report right away.
This one's easy, guys.  Old Zeke's been watchin' too many horror movies and eating too much greasy popcorn.
Yo, balloon man, we've got some real work for you:  How about analyzing this?
I don't wanna hear about it, Egon.  We've had a long night in a not-too-fragrant barnyard, so I'm taking a shower and hitting the sheets.
Slimer comes shooting out through shower nozzle, hugs Peter tightly around the neck and scaring the hell out of him.
Well, Slimer, I don't see anything here that looks like a monster.
What'd you do to Egon, you bird-brain!
What's wrong with you guys?  That thing ate Egon!
Come to think of it, there was a certain resemblance.
Ray, what's this have to do with Egon being a chicken?
Sit down, Egon, we have some good news and some bad news.
Take it easy, Egon.  You're gonna be fine.
Let's stop that thing before it makes drumsticks out of anyone else!
All quiet on the chicken front.  How about down there?
It's how big?  Okay, Ray, I admit you were right about these Werechickens,...
...but I definitely don't buy them growing to the size of buildings.
Ray, you were right!  The chicken's here, and he's a walking high-rise!
It's heading down 34th toward the Empire State Building.
Tell me, how do I get out of this chicken outfit?
And Winston's in the kitchen doing your dishes.
It sure feels strange not having Egon with us.
Did it have any distinguishing marks?
No, Peter, I think we're dealing with a bonafide werechicken here.
What'd I tell you, Peter?  A werechicken egg!  Gimme a hand, Winston!
Oh no, I'm not leavin'.  The werechicken that laid this has gotta be around here someplace -- and I'm gonna find it.
It's in here -- I can feel it.
Well, that takes care of one werechicken.
Now to find the six-footer that ate Zeke's wife.
Peter, that is Egon!  The egg hatched, he was bitten and now he's a werechicken!
Werechickens only appear during a full moon, and for the next few minutes, the moon's not full.
"The werechicken appears during the full moon.  Anyone it bites will turn into another werechicken."
That egg Peter brought in, it hatched and...
According to this, there is an antidote.
"One tablespoon paprika, one clove of garlic, some parsley for color, cup of gelatin..."
Then we've gotta go with this!  C'mon!
The potion only partly worked, because of the missing chickenbane.
The werechicken that bit Egon.  It's still out there somewhere.
Peter, that's not a bed idea!  Chicken freezes at very low temperatures!
It looks like it's about to lay an --
I think I've finally perfected it.  Watch this, guys.
Interesting.  That's the second biggest egg I've ever seen.
Thanks for the help, Slimer, but I don't have time to examine this egg tonight.  I have to prepare for my weather balloon demonstration tomorrow morning.
But it'll be safe in here.
I remember the bite clearly.  How long will I stay like this?
As Egon drinks, his arms transform into wings and he drops the bowl, breaking it.
Don't get your feathers ruffled, Peter.
Startled, Egon flutters up off the sill, gravity takes over, and he lands on his feathered butt.
It's a long story, Janine.   Can you get my coat, please?  I'm due at the weather board in forty-five...
Trust me.  I'm of sound mind at least.
Distinguished members of the Weather Board, my weather balloon has the clu-cluck-clu-
... of entering the upper atmosphere where clu-cluck-clu cloud formations occur.
I, er, can explain this, but --
Yes, but you'll have to work the controls.
Okay, Peter, the balloon's in position.
I'm actually starting to like it.
Then he comes shooting out the back of the bag, the lower half of his body flat as a Frisbee.
shakes himself off like a dog, spraying slime all over Peter.
With a loud BANG, the oven practically explodes and the door flies off.
Slimer barrels up through sink faucet, leaving his bib stuck in the opening.
Nevermind, Egon, wouldn't want you to strain yourself.
Ready for this one?  Some farmer says his wife was eaten by a giant chicken.
But wouldn't it be somethin' if he sells that weather balloon idea of his?  He'll be a rich man!
Let's get it back to Headquarters and run some tests.  Then maybe we'll have some answers.
Ray, it's gettin' pretty late.  Maybe there really isn't any...
Ray, I just had a thought...
What if that six-foot werechicken is Zeke's wife?
What happened?  He's so quiet all of a sudden.
You've been turned into a werechicken!
How could we lose a fifteen foot-tall chicken?
Trap's full!  Somebody forgot to empty it!
Yeah, but how do you freeze a 50-foot chicken in August?
I don't want to hear it.
It's just Slimer groovin' to his new James Brown tape.
still oblivious as he works in the suddenly empty room.
Hovering at table, still preparing for feast.  He puts on a bib, unaware of oven shaking behind him.
flings it open, Slimer right behind him.
It's in there!  A big chicken!  It's gotta be ten feet tall!
A giant chicken just came through here --
Yeah!  Look what it did to those cars!
It makes a steep, banking dive and gets the hell out of there, barely escaping the big Werechicken's beak that SNAPS shut on thin air just behind Ecto-2's retreating tail.
Are you sure you wanna go to a meeting like -- this?
Ray's boot stomps on trigger and trap springs open.  As the Spirit comes into contact with the trap a small STORM ERUPTS around it.  SPARKS and LIGHTNING BOLTS fly.  A HURRICANE-like WIND BLOWS.

turn off their proton guns and are KNOCKED down by the released force as the freed Monstrous Spirit whooshes skyward.  The STORM abruptly disappears, as if SUCKED up.  The trap stops shaking and SNAPS shut.
There, it can electronically alter weather cut-cut-cut-con-ditions to produce sun, rain, or...
